sentences.en: A high beam energy is also used to stimulate x - ray emission of higher - energy peaks .
sentences.cn: 高能量电子束也能用来激发 高能量 X 射线峰的发射.

sentences.en: All data are completely integrated for emission summary purposes.
sentences.cn: 所有的数据被全部汇集以达到累积排放量的目的.

sentences.en: An example is the emission of light from matter.
Britain agreed to cut emissions of nitrogen oxide from power stations.
sentences.cn: 英国同意减少发电站氮氧化物的排放量。

sentences.en: One set of provisions tightens emission standards.
sentences.cn: 一套使排放标准更加严格的规定.

sentences.en: Spontaneous photons initiate stimulated emission and the chain reaction begins.
sentences.cn: 自发发射的光子引起受激发射,开始了链式反应.

sentences.en: States have the option of adopting the even tougher California emission standards.
sentences.cn: 各州也可以任意选择,是否采用加利福尼亚州更严格的排污标准.

sentences.en: The distinct processes are involved in X - ray emission.
sentences.cn: X 射线的发射,包含两种不同的过程.

sentences.en: the emission of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere
The emission of gases such as carbon dioxide should be stabilised at their present level.
sentences.cn: 二氧化碳等气体的排放应该稳定在当前水平。

sentences.en: The foregoing paragraphs have focused on the feasibility of individual sources complying with emission limitations.
sentences.cn: 前部分集中在个别污染源遵守排放限制的可行性问题上.

sentences.en: The liberation of electrons from a hot wire is called thermionic emission.
sentences.cn: 电子从热灯丝逸出,叫做热电子发射.

sentences.en: There was an audible emission of breath from the Duke.
sentences.cn: 这时听到公爵叹了一口气.

sentences.en: This emission of heat is completely independent of temperature and pressure.
sentences.cn: 这热的散发全然不受温度和压力的影响.

sentences.en: Thus, noncontinuous emission limitations were appropriate only when continuous controls were infeasible.
sentences.cn: 因此, 非持续性排放限制只有在持续性控制技术变得不可行时才是适当的.

words.tran_cn: （光、热等的）[物]发射，散发；喷射；发行

phrases.tran_cn: 声发射，声频发射；声发射检验

碳排放；碳排放量；二氧化碳排放
粉尘排放，烟尘排放；[机]扬尘量
排放控制；废气排出控制；发射控制；散发污染物管理规则
场致发射；自动发射；静电发射；电场发射
瓦斯泄出；气体放出；瓦斯喷出
污染物排放；污染发散物
[化]正电子成象术；正电子放射断层造影术

trans.tran_cn: 发出（气体、热量、光线等的），排放（物）
trans.tran_en: a gas or other substance that is sent into the air
